text:
Bayer's mission is 'Health
for all, and hunger for none'.

This is a very complex
and serious problem,

and to tackle it, we
value our relationships

with companies such as
Amazon Web Services.

- Bayer drives cloud fluency
throughout our data science
teams, and that's a very important aspect
of the Decision Science Ecosystem.

- The Decision Science
Ecosystem is both a technology

and a cultural approach
to bring decision science

to a centralized environment
whereby individuals can share
code and models
and streamline the work
to deliver the technologies that we need.

- AWS training is a
key aspect of adoption.
So we are coming from a place that a lot

of our data scientists
they have been operating

without digital tools or
without cloud understanding

and getting them to be
more efficient operating
and creating digital solutions,

that's the only way we can
really drive adoption in a
scalable way across the organization.

AWS has been a great partner
into building the DSE.
We leverage products like SageMaker
and Bedrock so we can create

that cohesive experience
integrated with internal tools
that we have within Bayer.

And training is always
going to be a big part of that.

because every time we bring a
new tool within the ecosystem,

we have to think how are we
going to get people on board

to better and more
efficiently operate within it.

- AWS worked with us to
personalize our training

and learning paths that
each employee would need.
Within the Decision Science Ecosystem,

we've trained roughly a
thousand different employees

utilizing AWS trainings
and AWS Skill Builder.
Before AWS Training
and Certification,

our Decision Science
Ecosystem users had about 20%
comfortability and familiarity

with various AWS cloud
services. Post training
and certification

they now have over 70%
comfortability navigating the

different cloud service
technologies that AWS provides.

That's not only allowed us
to migrate off of other types

of services and platforms
and focus primarily on AWS,

but also has contributed
to increased collaboration.

- Without these foundations,
users wouldn't understand

where their work fits
in the broader landscape
and potential opportunities.
- The ability of us being able

to launch development
environments that are safe

and secure in a matter
of hours instead of days,

we're going to be able to
bring better innovation,

more integrated experience
with our growers and farmers,

and we can really focus on
reducing our time to market
for our products within Bayer.
The collaboration between Bayer
and AWS has been key

to really speed up our
development process.
